definition: strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)

sentences.english: To steal the magnetic stripe information from credit cards should be considered as preliminary crime.
sentences.chinese: 竊取他人信用卡磁條信息應定信用卡詐騙罪的預備犯。

sentences.english: Data from the card is obtained from a magnetic stripe or chip on the card;
sentences.chinese: 信用卡數據可由卡片上的磁條或芯片讀取。

sentences.english: Critical to these results are magnetic stripe patterns in the seafloor.
sentences.chinese: 這些成果的關鍵是在海底磁條模式。

sentences.english: Magnetic strips affixed in each of the two volumes would identify that both had been removed.
sentences.chinese: 附着在兩書上的磁條會證實它們被帶走了。

sentences.english: An optional magnetic stripe-encoding module is available.
sentences.chinese: 打印機還有一個可選磁條編碼模塊。

sentences.english: The equipment necessary to clone a magnetic stripe card is cheap and readily available.
sentences.chinese: 克隆磁條卡所需的設備很便宜並且容易得到。

sentences.english: Which one of the following statements would best describe magnetic stripe technology?
sentences.chinese: 其中下列情形之一的報表將最好的形容磁條技術？

definition: to report the loss of something
a device used to check money and detect counterfeit bills
to replace a purchase/to exchange a purchase
alarm (e.g. burglar or fire alarm)/warning device
